data.text:
Thursday is #GirlsinICT Day! 

We can all defy the stereotypes & biases that continue to prevent women & girls from pursuing science subjects and excelling in their careers. More from @ITU: https://t.co/mmLMYJ2kAU https://t.co/3YnHyyHoj8

Plant a tree 🌳
Cut your food waste 🍝
Recycle ♻
Buy local 🏘

More #ClimateAction ideas how you can #ActNow to make every day #EarthDay 👉 https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/60d1fHKZO0

“Together, we can foster not only a green – but also a blue – recovery from the #COVID19 pandemic & help ensure a long term resilient & sustainable relationship with the ocean.” 

-- @antonioguterres #SaveOurOcean https://t.co/F27Lg2yvnP

The entrenched legacy of discriminatory policies & systems must be decisively uprooted in order to achieve racial justice & equality.

-- @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet following guilty verdict in George Floyd murder case. https://t.co/JOtn4Hs9KY

https://t.co/5piK6GZUNf

The world passed a tragic milestone this week — 3 millions lives lost to #COVID19. 

Together, we remember those we have loved & lost.  

#OnlyTogether can we end this pandemic — by ensuring that people around the world can get the vaccine. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/vr7K74U98h

#COVID19 has fundamentally changed lives around the world, including the way many of us work. 

#ILOGreenWeek explores the future of green jobs & more. https://t.co/iR20VyY2NV via @ILO https://t.co/pJZDxdue0Q

When fasting for Ramadan, it's important to stay hydrated! Be sure to drink at least 8 glasses of water between Iftar & Suhour. 

Reducing caffeine & avoiding sugary drinks can also help you stay happy & healthy.

More Ramadan nutrition tips from @WFP: https://t.co/4ND2ocflLZ https://t.co/VCfD6lSNwC

2021 is a crucial year for decisive #ClimateAction. 

Protecting our planet is in everyone's interest & everyone has a role to play.

Ahead of Thursday's #EarthDay, see how you can #ActNow to help build a more sustainable world: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/XMeOQEB0ms

From the #GlobalGoals to #COVID19 to #ClimateAction, creativity & innovation are needed to tackle the world's biggest challenges. 

Wednesday is World Creativity & Innovation Day. https://t.co/0rY6LlUhiy https://t.co/4RufCGxMT2

Saint Vincent and the Grenadines: UN launches $29.2 million global appeal to help those affected by La Soufrière volcano. 

Funding to provide immediate lifesaving humanitarian assistance, including clean water, and support sustainable recovery. https://t.co/oVcPtFbs2z

Creative industries have been strengthened by digitalization & a surge in demand due to the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Learn more about the International Year of Creative Economy on Wednesday's  World Creativity & Innovation Day: https://t.co/A55yxIW081 https://t.co/hrDprEeRsV

Racism & intolerance are problems prevalent in all societies. 

But each of us can #StandUp4HumanRights and #FightRacism, discrimination & hatred. https://t.co/rUmbZH7FDz https://t.co/38ZfFeQTbB

Children face grave harm due to continued conflict & widespread displacement in Ethiopia's Tigray region.

A disturbing picture has emerged of severe & ongoing child rights violations, warns @UNICEF. 
https://t.co/ObsgvuJLTA

.@WFP will soon be providing school meals in Venezuela.

Through the programme, 1.5 million children are expected to receive nutritious meals by the end of the next school year. https://t.co/gd1aVpOedA https://t.co/FmzQGlbSls

"This is personal for me.
You too can protect what is left and repair what has been damaged."
 
Ahead of #EarthDay, @UNEP Goodwill Ambassador @AidanRGallagher asks everyone to join him in supporting the #ParisAgreement and taking urgent #ClimateAction. https://t.co/3QKMYqRPkW https://t.co/b0FoTPMu7S

"The international community has a responsibility to do what it can to protect the lives of innocent people in countries that are unable or unwilling to do so, or are in fact attacking them."

-- @RapporteurUn on the situation of human rights in Myanmar.
https://t.co/UzYVFkWgqZ

2020 was among the warmest years on record, but temperatures are only one aspect of the climate crisis. 
Sea level rise continues.
Drought, heat, floods & wildfires affect countries around the world. 

More on the urgent need for #ClimateAction from @WMO: https://t.co/jvYHpjOQau https://t.co/56XNgOlLNR

联合国中文日快乐 - Tuesday is Chinese Language Day.

Chinese is one of the UN's six official languages.

Get our Chinese-language social media updates here: https://t.co/so2wg0DSte https://t.co/zoJmXgzwLf

"As we work to recover from the pandemic, we must prioritize inclusion and sustainable development that protects and benefits all people"

-- @antonioguterres tells UN Permanent Forum on Indigenous Issues. #WeAreIndigenous
https://t.co/vTRJKwXVtC

For many LGBTIQ+ people, leaving their hometowns is the only way to find a place where they can truly be themselves. 

See how YOU can help create a future where everyone belongs – no matter who they are or whom they love: https://t.co/ELPttj0KZE #StandUp4Migrants https://t.co/lAql7yL1bz

"We can no longer separate the health crisis from the ecological crisis."

-- Climate activist @GretaThunberg donates 100,000 Euros to support global efforts to ensure a more equitable access to #COVID19 vaccines through the UN-led COVAX initiative.
https://t.co/NO451ulg0O

Soil is a living resource, home to more than 25% of our Earth's biodiversity.

Yet, we are losing soil biodiversity at an alarming rate.

@FAO explains how we can protect it: https://t.co/fPeokSsjn6 #ClimateAction

https://t.co/sseS9FiH0S

Myanmar: "I urge regional actors to leverage their influence to prevent further deterioration and, ultimately, find a peaceful way out of this catastrophe."

-- @antonioguterres tells Security Council.
https://t.co/bwSWH6bWx8

🌡2020 was 1 of 3 warmest years on record, with:
🧊ice sheets melting,
💧ocean heat at record levels,
🔥wildfires, 🌊flooding, 🌀hurricanes & other worsening impacts of the climate crisis, all pointing to urgent need for #ClimateAction.

More from @WMO: https://t.co/jvYHpjOQau https://t.co/Fl67Fu7Xek

.@UNHumanRights independent experts strongly reject UK Government-backed report on racism, arguing that it distorts & falsifies historic facts, warning it could fuel racial discrimination.
https://t.co/UzrPzbhR3n

The active involvement of #WomenInPeacekeeping - from conducting operational activities to interacting with local communities - is a vital part of @UNPeacekeeping. https://t.co/JlWYyEQpfh via @UNIFIL_

 https://t.co/9XzVHu5Ukl

The UN Permanent Forum on Indigenous Issues kicks off virtually on Monday.

Follow @UN4Indigenous for updates & use #WeAreIndigenous to join the conversation! https://t.co/YwZjtrDgnF https://t.co/r6U7qW1cVF

🦗 Desert locusts have threatened the food security & livelihoods of millions of people in East Africa for more than a year.

@FAO is using biopesticides to help control the outbreak without harming the environment: https://t.co/tnJw9ybkFa https://t.co/AtyaWcTk9s

#VaccinesWork & are a safe, effective way to protect you and your loved ones against deadly diseases. Yet, a growing number of networks seek to undermine trust in vaccinations with misinformation.

Help share verified information that saves lives: https://t.co/9cNARG43wd https://t.co/c1ajupuBvk

85% of museums worldwide had to close or partially close in 2020 due to the pandemic. 

Latest report from @UNESCO discusses the essential role of museums for culture & heritage. https://t.co/B8zxOuBKxU https://t.co/Nq9zs82HTP

Bodily autonomy is the power & agency to make choices about one’s own body & future.

It is a human right that helps ensure people - particularly women & girls - can live healthy lives & maximize their potential. 

More from @UNFPA. https://t.co/rsARvWTEv7 https://t.co/lLW3qGZPZ7

"We must actively seek differing perspectives and promote open exchanges of ideas, especially with those whose views differ from our own."

-- @CIJ_ICJ President Joan E. Donoghue, as the Court marks 75 years of promoting peace & security around the world. https://t.co/p7HIP9MI17

Every year, an estimated 11.2 billion tonnes of solid waste is collected worldwide. 

Be a #ClimateAction Superhero and help save resources by recycling rather than discarding, bringing your own shopping bag and using a refillable water bottle. https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 #ActNow https://t.co/gMtkxG9kQf

Sunday marks 75 years of the @CIJ_ICJ serving as the UN's principal judicial body - helping to maintain peace & security by settling legal disputes between countries. 

Learn more about the Court: https://t.co/0F9o3dy2jP https://t.co/c2YThXvJzQ

Food is the foundation of our cultures, economies & our relationship with the natural world.

In July, global leaders will unite to launch bold actions towards sustainable #FoodSystems & the #GlobalGoals. 

More on the @FoodSystems Pre-summit: https://t.co/XnBIQHKL1O https://t.co/VN2mJR9yGE

Communities, governments, businesses & organizations around the world are taking bold #ClimateAction.

The UN Global Climate Action Awards shine a light on some of the world’s most inspiring solutions. @UNFCCC explains how you can apply until 30 April: https://t.co/eTUAGejTTG https://t.co/8pXvfTUAUU

The @Tokyo2020 Olympics will have close to equal representation of women & men competing for the first time in the history of the games.

@UN_Women explains how #WomenInSport defy gender stereotypes, make inspiring role models & demonstrate equality. https://t.co/VxYab85Zty https://t.co/2QWsKAXSEP

#ActNow to become part of the zero-waste fashion movement:
👚 Buy eco-friendly clothes 
👖 Shop second-hand 
♻️ Upcycle your old clothes

Every #ClimateAction counts. 👉 https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/9Yvt5HQW8J

Nurses
doctors
teachers
sanitation workers
journalists
truck drivers
grocery store workers
researchers
& all essential workers

are risking their well-being to serve their communities.

We thank them for being on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic.

🎨: Chiara Fiori https://t.co/kOavn8IXFQ

"We need to stand together and #ActNow. We only have one earth and every action counts."

Join newest @FAO's Goodwill Ambassador, @Thom_astro, in taking #ClimateAction to protect people & planet: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV https://t.co/CPZENpzBQ8

As #COVID19 continues to spread, there are steps we can all take to keep ourselves and our families safe:

😷Wear a mask
🙂↔️🙂Maintain physical distance
👐🧼Wash your hands frequently
🪟🚪Open windows & doors.

More tips: https://t.co/FU7mXLfaxO https://t.co/OG1aM0pef9

“Vaccine equity is the challenge of our time. And we are failing."

-- @WHO Chief @DrTedros - as UN, government, scientific & civil society leaders call for solidarity & share solutions aimed at improving equal access to #COVID19 vaccines. https://t.co/cnAqsQhQo1

Indigenous women play key roles in their communities & beyond.

Join us in standing with indigenous women & girls as they strive for their rights, protection and a seat at the table where decisions are made. #WeAreIndigenous via @UN_Women https://t.co/xuTLL95G88

Libya: UN Security Council unanimously calls for all foreign forces and mercenaries to leave the country and gives green light for a UN team to monitor last October’s historic ceasefire agreement.
https://t.co/t3MdCPPZM1

#COVID19 infections are quickly approaching highest rates since start of the pandemic. 

Dangerous increases highlight the need for vaccine equity, says @WHO, as the UN health agency works to strengthen global monitoring & assessment of new variants. https://t.co/ITgcLuFw12

"Cities are already succeeding on #ClimateAction.
The challenge is to speed up & scale up. Key areas for action are phasing out coal & investing in climate-smart buildings & transport systems."

-- @antonioguterres tells @c40cities mayors. https://t.co/o4XylG2vCw https://t.co/uEluG6CfNQ

#VaccinesWork

They help prevent millions of deaths every year & are continuously monitored to ensure they are safe & effective.

More facts from @WHO: https://t.co/VG261Da7uZ https://t.co/Uri3DvJ0Pv

The work of @UNPeacekeeping to end sexual violence in conflict upholds the dignity & human rights of survivors while protecting them from further harm, stigma & marginalization.
More on our efforts to help prevent & #EndRapeInWar: https://t.co/vvFwxkVtIR https://t.co/tje3vgLy2c

New UN-backed framework to boost agricultural trade between African countries will help:
🥑 Improve food security
👩‍🌾 Create jobs
📈 Support sustainable, inclusive growth
Details from @FAO: https://t.co/RbrVsQpfDa

https://t.co/poObZlLGpU

“The worst health & economic downturn in our lifetime has laid bare & exacerbated the vulnerabilities in our economies & societies, leading some to describe #COVID19 as the inequality virus.”

-- @AminaJMohammed at UN #Fin4Dev forum.
https://t.co/k4GECMypzs

A lack of new treatments for common infections has left people dangerously exposed to some of the world’s most dangerous bacteria, @WHO warns. 

Antimicrobial resistance poses a serious threat, particularly to children & other vulnerable people. https://t.co/p9FpsU8mdV

There is reason for hope for an end of the war in Yemen, @OSE_Yemen Martin Griffiths tells the Security Council, calling on all involved not to disappoint but rather deliver Yemen from its plight. 
https://t.co/thdIWpKJR8

Around 38 million #COVID19 vaccine doses have reached over 100 countries, through the UN-led COVAX initiative.

Continued funding for the global vaccination effort is essential to ensure everyone is protected. 

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/Md7JtFyk4v

Saint Vincent and the Grenadines: UN set to launch funding appeal to support people being affected by ongoing volcanic activity on the Caribbean island. 

Humanitarians working to provide basic services, including clean drinking water. https://t.co/8K0KQSNg2w

Millions of people worldwide are denied a nationality, which can prevent them from attending school, seeing a doctor, getting a job & more. 

Having a nationality is not a privilege - it's a human right. https://t.co/gp2Y3Bgxml via @Refugees https://t.co/LgAsfwV4Bt

Fruits & veggies must be handled with care across the supply chain to: 🍽️ ensure they are safe to eat
🗑️ reduce food loss
🥦 protect their quality & nutritional value
More on the Year of Fruits & Vegetables via @FAO: https://t.co/ZkuL7ySznx #IYFV2021

https://t.co/q9OUkMkQix

Thousands of creators from around the world have used their art to help stop the spread of #COVID19 & unite people around the world during the pandemic. 

On Thursday's #WorldArtDay, join us in thanking them for their commitment and support! https://t.co/AKDwlSdeWA https://t.co/PI50Oq85L4

💉 Making vaccine roll-out possible 
🏥 Powering emergency clinics in conflict areas
🌱 Supporting #ClimateAction & a green recovery  

@UNDP explains three ways solar energy ☀️ powers the fight against #COVID19: 
https://t.co/7pFpPiI4Lz

In times of crisis, we need culture & artists more than ever.

🎨 On Thursday's #WorldArtDay, join us in recognizing how art is helping people around the world cope with the pandemic. 

More from @UNESCO: https://t.co/4VKoGBDPpW https://t.co/WpZGz1HOxs

Improving access to diabetes diagnostic tools & treatment are the key goals of new @WHO's initiative aiming to tackle persisting increase in diabetes cases & related deaths globally.
https://t.co/D9fjlS9QCr

"Do unto others as you would have them do unto you" - the 'Golden Rule' mosaic at UNHQ, based on the painting by US artist Norman Rockwell.

On Thursday's #WorldArtDay, we celebrate the power of art to provide comfort in times of crisis & difficulty. https://t.co/4VKoGBme1m https://t.co/XsQR8zgsj2

This is a turning point in history.

-- UN special representative to @endrapeinwar says that #COVID19 demands a paradigm shift: silence the guns & amplify the voices of women; invest in public welfare rather than warfare. 
https://t.co/nRAbm1JuYy

Bodily autonomy - the power & agency to make choices about your own body & future - is a human right.

#StandUp4HumanRights and join @UNFPA and others around the world in saying: #MyBodyIsMyOwn. https://t.co/rsARvWC3Dz https://t.co/e32EIw9Rb1

"I always had this feeling that I could serve better in public health, in areas where my help is most needed."

-- @UNICEF's Aboubacar Kampo talks to @MelissaFleming about the motivation behind his career on our podcast 'Awake At Night'. https://t.co/l5jlSqXt9b https://t.co/LbIaO0bdAa

Strong women can help inspire strong girls - and together, we can all help achieve #GenerationEquality.

@UN_Women works to promote gender equality around the world. https://t.co/9DkJpsxvFB https://t.co/nd7QwgDLad

More investment is needed to end AIDS by 2030.

@UNAIDS says financial cuts have come at a tragic human cost, and urges donors & wealthier countries to put the world back on track by investing wisely in the HIV response. https://t.co/dTxMAfQid8 https://t.co/HOTyxbUKWd

Chagas is a tropical disease caused by parasites affecting 6-7 million people, mostly in Latin America. 

With prompt treatment, the disease is curable.

More from @WHO on Wednesday's #WorldChagasDay: https://t.co/4MvxSoqIR2 https://t.co/PrcccAAs15

The women & men #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping come from all over the world and have a broad range of backgrounds, from military to civil affairs to public information. 

Learn how YOU can become a peacekeeper: https://t.co/vSfmjHYFUD https://t.co/84B0HyFl6N

Ramadan Kareem!

As Muslims around the world begin observing #Ramadan, the UN family sends wishes of peace, compassion and solidarity

See some examples in our latest @Twittermoments: https://t.co/uw3aqerOrx

"I fear the situation in Myanmar is heading towards a full-blown conflict. States must not allow the deadly mistakes of the past in Syria and elsewhere to be repeated." 

-- @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet. https://t.co/2mMK4LnOSZ

Saint Vincent and the Grenadines: The UN is providing vital humanitarian aid, including health care, food & shelter, following the volcanic eruption that left thousands evacuated & without clean water in the Caribbean country.

https://t.co/qey0K5S385

The non-medical use of opioids is a major threat to public health. 

@UNODC is leading the global response to the opioid crisis. https://t.co/UAnnDM3ctO #CND2021 https://t.co/NpeGL6ANgC

Stronger institutions are needed to recover from #COVID19 & achieve the #GlobalGoals.

The Committee of Experts on Public Information meets virtually this week to discuss building inclusive, effective & resilient institutions for a better future. https://t.co/QjE55b3mfP https://t.co/hG8XqrW1Tz

"The #COVID19 pandemic is our most immediate challenge, but we cannot ignore the other significant fragilities it has highlighted."

-- @antonioguterres at UN #Fin4Dev forum.  https://t.co/gCUfOZsPBc

We are in the pandemic together -- and #OnlyTogether will we end the #COVID19 crisis.

Check out our latest @TwitterMoments for examples of solidarity and compassion, which show the very best of humanity.
https://t.co/XGJRuNuCfo

Units of the Syrian Arab Air Force used chemical weapons in Saraqib, Syria in February 2018, says new @OPCW report.
https://t.co/V0nV5bXCVp

Africa's Great Lakes region needs further support to foster more equitable & affordable access to #COVID19 vaccines, Special Envoy @HuangXia16 tells Security Council.

No one is safe until everyone is safe. 
#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. 
https://t.co/uQ6JTABJec

Peace and compassion are the focus of Muslims around the world during this month of #Ramadan. 

Ramadan Kareem! https://t.co/roCtXTbRi5

Welcome to the UN family, @Thom_astro!

The @ESA Astronaut - and newest @FAO's Goodwill Ambassador - will use his voice & unique perspective from space to advocate for #ClimateAction & to help reduce hunger. https://t.co/pQn4cUrYqI https://t.co/4tqHyfdGGz

An entire generation is in danger in Yemen.
Together we can help them survive this urgent humanitarian crisis.
-- @Refugees Goodwill Ambassador Cate Blanchett.
Find out how you can support the people of Yemen: https://t.co/aM6b3kwkKy

https://t.co/NEusyxMQXL

On this day 60 years ago, the first human space flight took place, a historic event that opened the way for space exploration for the benefit of all humanity.

More on Monday's International Day of Human Space Flight 👨‍🚀👩‍🚀🚀: https://t.co/sxDXZzKXoM https://t.co/Ewgxq54ogc

Happening this week: 64th session of the Commission on Narcotic Drugs.

Learn about the Commission's work to protect people's health & well-being by helping to address the world drug problem. https://t.co/mMMIqcPOsA #CND2021 https://t.co/G5KI0jLbMH
On Monday's International Day of Human Space Flight, @UNOOSA explains how space science, technology & exploration contribute to the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/v36eaE5cJu https://t.co/N9gOZLp1zB

Pop-up vaccination clinics are helping to protect vulnerable indigenous communities from #COVID19 in the Amazon region of Colombia. 

The UN & partners are working to reach some of the worlds most vulnerable people with lifesaving vaccines. https://t.co/EkChCNi2JZ https://t.co/6eaHfBtmYF

60 years ago, Yuri Gagarin became the 1st human to orbit the Earth. He visited the UN with fellow astronaut Valentina Tereshkova after she became the 1st woman in space.

On Monday's Human Space Flight Day, learn more about the beginning of the space era: https://t.co/JWVtqoBO06 https://t.co/uOua6Yq6Om

The climate crisis is a menace to the world.

Check out our @TikTok_us account to see how anyone can be a #ClimateAction Superhero & help protect our one & only planet.

Get inspired to #ActNow: https://t.co/nAjeCApKJ4 https://t.co/ghEH0Jptmd

When Holocaust distortion is left unchallenged, it can lead to Holocaust denial, antisemitism, conspiracy myths & dangerous forms of nationalism.

We can all do our part to #ProtectTheFacts about the Holocaust. https://t.co/uJ3Y1F7isI https://t.co/EushHUO0bt

People become refugees not by choice, but forced by circumstances.

For 70+ years, @Refugees has worked to save lives, protect rights & build a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities & stateless people. https://t.co/h9sBXHUK7v https://t.co/eB5uSedQJq

#COVID19 closures have left children who depend on daily school meals missing out on a reliable source of nutrition. 

@UNICEF says getting students back into their classrooms is critical for their well-being. https://t.co/MOtTOyi2h7 https://t.co/ADhKZTgpqX

Without an inclusive recovery, a decade worth of critical development could be lost. 

Upcoming #Fin4Dev Forum & #GlobalGoals Investment fair will explore how to create a better future for all. https://t.co/CAerG1wvGI https://t.co/z8RzvHjM4B

This week marked a major milestone: 100 countries & areas have now received life-saving #COVID19 vaccines through COVAX, the UN-led initiative to promote equitable vaccine access.

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. via @UNICEF https://t.co/zO351kIqxy

Together we have the power to end the #COVID19 pandemic faster – but only if people around the world can get a vaccine. 

#OnlyTogether can we ensure everyone is protected so we can get back to the things we love. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/Aw42Pynr77

#COVID19 is highlighting the urgent need to ensure affordable, reliable energy for:

🏥 hospital & health facilities
🚰 clean water systems
👨‍💻 remote learning & more

Details from @UNDESA on global efforts towards sustainable energy: https://t.co/AP5KUJ3RtN https://t.co/JtBFIsPbkl

"The recovery will be very, very tough for many countries because of the crisis that we are seeing right now." 

-- @UNICEF's @AbouKampo shares his concerns about the long-term impact of #COVID19 with @MelissaFleming on Awake At Night.

With #COVID19, no one is safe until everyone is safe. 

We must ensure that the most vulnerable, including migrants & other people on the move, are able to access vaccines. #OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic.

More from @UNMigration: https://t.co/QOVGuBQhTD #VaccinEquity https://t.co/awIZ0pMW94

#COVID19 is a global health crisis that requires solidarity & a unified response.

The #GlobalGoals call for universal health coverage, including fair & equal access to vaccines for all. https://t.co/rqjF9Op9n9 https://t.co/OG99zmSDEp

Like all viruses, #COVID19 is changing as it spreads. 

If you have to be with others, taking precautions such as wearing masks and opening doors & windows to let fresh air in, can help keep everyone safe.

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/vUDk1TJ4BX
